Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery oinochoe or amphora; exterior, beige-cream slip: black-figure decoration consisting of confronting feline and goat (of feline, forelegs and edge of snout remaining, to right; of goat, head with eye in added red and one foreleg remaining, to left); incised splinter rosettes and one rosette marked with red as filling ornament; below, two bands above glazed area.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.644)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (37, pl. 18, 41)
